result.execSummary:
The defendant Brandon James Burdick #349022 was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Brandon James Burdick #349022 is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Brandon James Burdick #349022 was found guilty of Exposing Genitals/Pubic Area/Intimate Parts to a Child [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.10(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
Must undergo psychological evaluation and comply as per agent.  No unsupervised contact with any females under 18.  No contact with victims of all cases.  AODA and comply.  Must have sex offender evaluation and treatment.  Register as a sex offender for life on CF case.

Cts.  2,4,5,6, & 7 dismissed.

records.addlTxt: filed by Court Reporter Karen Blair, June 29, 2015 plea/sentencing
filed by Atty Severson
filed by Atty Severson

Defendant Brandon James Burdick #349022 in court, in custody with attorney Brian Severson.  Christine M. Genda appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cases called:  13CM36, 15CM63, 14CM17, & 14CF386.  Defendant pled no contest to Ct. 1 of 14CF386,  Ct. 1 of 14CM17, and Ct. 1 of 13CM36.  Court found guilty.  Judgment was entered.  In 14CF386  Court dismissed Cts. 2, 4,5,6, & 7,  Ct. 3 dismissed but read in.  Court sentenced defendant to serve 5 years in prison.  3 years initial confinement,  2 years extended supervision, consecutive to any sentence currently serving.  $518.00 costs.  In 14CM17 Court dismissed Ct. 2, sentenced defendant on Ct. 1 to serve 2 years in prison, consecutive to any previous sentence.  1 year initial confinement,  1 year extended supervision.  $443.00 costs.  In 13CM36 Ct. 2 dismissed.  Court withheld sentencing placed defendant on probation for 1 year, consecutive to all the prior sentences.  $253.00 costs.  15CM63 is dismissed but read in.  On all cases conditions of probation/extended supervision are:  Must undergo psychological evaluation and comply as per agent.  No unsupervised contact with any females under 18.  No contact with victims of all cases.  AODA and comply.  Register as a sex offender on CF case for life  Must have sex offender evaluation and treatment.  In 13CM36 1 day credit.  In 14CF386 2 days credit.  Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration program and Substance Abuse program.
with Petition for Writ of Habeas Corpus to Stanley Correctional Inst.  for 6/29/15 at 10:00 am.
plea/sentencing hearing on June 29, 2015 at 10:00 a.m.
